org.qteam.tinyicon

Class Icon

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.qteam.tinyicon.Icon

  • public final class Icon
extends java.lang.Object
    The concrete icon entry. The Icon class represents a single icon instance and it is the base entry to work with. It summarize (and simplify) most of the internal icon structures (See structs package).
    When a .ico file is decoded an internal ArrayList <Icon> is built; after that, several methods of the TinyIcon class can be used to get Icon instances.
    The most common usage is just to get the associated BufferedImage (getImage method), but some information (such as width, height, bpp, etc.) can also be queried.
    See Also:
    getIcon (int), getIcon (Predicate <Icon>), getLastIcon (), extractIcons (Predicate <Icon>)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Icon

        public Icon(int width,
            int height,
            int bpp,
            boolean isPng,
            java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
        Constructs a new Icon with the given parameters. This constructor is intended to be called only by TinyIcon class; there should no need to call it explicitly.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the icon in pixels.
        height - The height of the icon in pixels.
        bpp - Bits per pixel (Valid values: 1, 4, 8, 24, 32).
        isPng - True if the icon was compressed, false otherwise.
        image - The actual image pixels.
